name: Tom Duance
education: Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales
location: Newcastle Upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

experience.description: Responsibility for Finance, HR and Legal at a private equity backed retailer selling via a mixture of D2C and B2B channels in UK, USA and Europe. Refinancing debt facilities, leading Board meetings, strategy workstreams, implementing new ERP system and improving commercial reporting and decision-making.

Finance lead for Debenhams following its acquisition, helping shape the strategy to become the leading UK online department store across marketplace, beauty and own brand categories. Commercially focused with regular Board-level interaction whilst also managing other areas of finance such as controls, cash flow and accounting.

Leading all aspects of commercial finance for the Boohoo Womenswear brand, whilst also overseeing commercial finance teams for other acquired Group brands, including Nasty Gal, Karen Millen, Coast and Miss Pap. Leading the Group supply chain finance team on an interim basis, including warehousing, customer services, carriage and returns. Line management of up to seven direct reports.

Working closely with CEO, CFO and Directors across Marketing, Merchandising, Ecommerce and Operations to understand trading performance for the Group and ensure all business functions were aligned to sales and profitability targets. Implementing daily reporting, analysing gross margins, improving marketing ROI, operational efficiency and modelling strategic business initiatives.

Establishing a central Group FP&A team, embedding annual budget and quarterly reforecast cycles to align with AIM reporting deadlines, implementing weekly trading reporting, business partnering with all departments and challenging stakeholders to overachieve against budgeted KPls.

Implementing new financial models encompassing all business areas including financial, non-financial and operational forecasts. One of the first recruits into commercial finance, joining pre-IPO, with Board-level exposure from the outset.

Providing financial due diligence services (buy side, sell side and public company) to a wide range of businesses on acquisitions, mergers, disposals, refinancing and investments. Including UK PLCs, fast-growing privately-owned businesses, private equity houses and other financial institutions.
Leading teams on audit and accounts preparation assignments, from planning to completion. Management of diverse client portfolio, from sole trader to medium sized companies.
Team member on large company audit assignments and leading smaller audit assignments, including substantive audit work, controls planning/testing and statutory accounts review.
